subtasks: Start pruning the main scaffold.
Remove branches to create space between main branches.
Prune long branches to a fruit bud.
Tie up and shape branches for better growth direction.
Prune the top scaffold to maintain balanced growth.
Remove competing branches to focus growth on the leader.
Prune back branches to existing fruit buds.
Address structural issues such as dead or rubbing branches.
Inspect trees for damage or needed pruning.
Identify competing branches and remove as needed.
Shape branches to improve air circulation and light penetration.
Reduce tree height if necessary for access or structural reasons.
Leave fruit buds for future fruit production.
Trim overgrown branches to maintain tree size.
Remove vertical branches for better tree shape.
Adjust the central leader structure as part of the pruning regimen.
Foster healthy growth by pruning competing branches.
Tend to scaffold development for optimal fruit production.
** Start pruning the main scaffold.

** Prune long branches to a fruit bud.
** Tie up and shape branches for better growth direction.
** Prune the top scaffold to maintain balanced growth.
** Remove competing branches to focus growth on the leader.
** Prune back branches to existing fruit buds.
** Address structural issues such as dead or rubbing branches.
** Inspect trees for damage or needed pruning.
** Identify competing branches and remove as needed.
** Shape branches to improve air circulation and light penetration.
** Reduce tree height if necessary for access or structural reasons.
** Leave fruit buds for future fruit production.
** Trim overgrown branches to maintain tree size.
** Remove vertical branches for better tree shape.
** Adjust the central leader structure as part of the pruning regimen.
** Foster healthy growth by pruning competing branches.
** Tend to scaffold development for optimal fruit production.
